Reviews.Title: Wish I had known earlier
Reviews.Author: Jolly Roger
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 16 channel surveillance camera system (Lorex).  The adapters shipped with the package are rated at "2 Amps," and they attach to a 4-way splitter for power.  I discovered an 8-way splitter on Amazon, purchased that and swapped out the 4-way for the 8-way so I could power up to 8 cameras with 1 adapter.  I'm glad I ended up touching the adapter the next day...it was HOT!  I then did some research.  I am no electrician and I have no specialized knowledge thereon.  I wanted to write this review so others similarly situated might benefit.  To do so, though, I need to provide a little math (sorry!):I have two types of cameras:  bullets and domes.  The bullets are each rated to draw 500 milliamps; the domes pull 250 milliamps.  Incidentally, the bullets I have are here:  Lorex Weatherproof Super Plus Resolution Security Camera LBC7051.  Therefore, if one uses 4 such bullet cameras , that will pull 2 amps (i.e., 500 milliamps x 4 = 2 amps).  Eight bullets will pull 4 amps, etc.  So, I realized that I probably didn't have enough amps in my ADAPTERS to power the amount of cameras I had.I then discovered the Q-See adapter.  It was confusing because the picture only showed the 8-way splitter.  Rest assured, it does come with, also, a 4 way splitter and a 5 amp power adapter.  In using this, the adapter isn't nearly as hot and I feel comfortable that the adpater can handle my max load of 4 amps (i.e., if I power 8 bullets at once, each pulling 500 milliamps).So, my only regret is that I didn't find this item a bit earlier since I spent about $20 on two 8-way splitters that didn't even include a power adapter!  I'm happy I found this item...better late then never.  If I decide to expand my system where it would be helpful to purchase another one of these power adapter/splitter sets by Q-See, I hope they are still being sold from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for freeing up space on my surge protecter.
Reviews.Author: Jason Fraser
Reviews.Content: When buying individual or dual pack cameras, each camera comes with one adapter with one connection. With 16 cameras, that requires many plugs as well as space. With the 4 and 8-way power splitters connected to a 5 amp power adapter. I only nee two plugs and two power adapters. This creates a cleaner area and lessons the clutter of wires behind the DVR and fewer points where dust can collect.

Reviews.Title: Great adapter
Reviews.Author: Russell Stevens
Reviews.Content: Fully functioning product that is highly recommended. A must for your home security needs. Arrived in a safe and well packed manner

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: Thomas Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and I was told it does work perpect and was shipped fast perfect for the job

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Worked great with my Swann DVR, could not find this adapter with Swann unless i bought another DVR with 8 cameras

Reviews.Title: Second one is a Charm
Reviews.Author: Zborn
Reviews.Content: This power adapter is working perfectly.  Unfortunately the first one I received did not work.  Amazon was quick to replace it, and I mean quick.  They scheduled the pickup and sent a new one before I even had a chance to wrap up the first one.  The replacement is powering four cameras 24-7 and so far has no issues.I am waiting for a receipt from the delivery guy (as promised) However could care less as long as Amazon get it and make no additional claim.  I would recommend Amazon Prime...

Reviews.Title: Just What I Was Looking For
Reviews.Author: Kitty G.
Reviews.Content: I wanted a way to connect my 4 cameras to one power outlet without using a bulky power strip or 4 separate power adapters - this fit the bill perfectly.  All 4 cameras are analog wired, so I can run one siamese video/power cable from each camera. I then plug the video into the 4-channel balun which connects to a Cat 6 cable, and I plug the power connector into this cable. The plug end of the power can plug into an outlet in my attic, while the Cat 6 means just one line to run down to my DVR.Good product!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: It eliminated seven a/c power adapters,have less clutter and  looks much better and seems to be working as advertised thanks!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I ordered
Reviews.Author: Eric Beckman
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed, the description helped in my troubleshooting of the device and it arrived just as described.  Shipping was very quick to Nor Cal as well.

Reviews.Title: simple 8 way splitter works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Shenn
Reviews.Content: I have bought a few different cameras for my 8 camera Q-See system.  I had 4 power adapters that i was using to power all of them.  I decided this would be a better way to go.  Worked with no problems and all my cameras/mic's work fine.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Dale Johnson
Reviews.Content: it worked just fine.just what I thought it would be. would order again if one goes down. i'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had looked into getting one of these sooner
Reviews.Author: eddy kong
Reviews.Content: This one unit replaces 4 individual power adapters that took up too much space on my power outlet strip. Replaced all the 1 to 2 splitter adapters that I had to use to relocate the big square adapters. Fire department inspector was not happy with all the wiring before but was pleased with the new wiring of this power adapter

Reviews.Title: Great fix
Reviews.Author: Bobbie "Bobbie"
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect fix to our problem. Our old cable was failing and causing our camera to fade in and out.

Reviews.Title: Works great. Does what it says.
Reviews.Author: deadfolk
Reviews.Content: This is a quality replacement part.  works, great, does what it says, no issues whatsoever.  Seems to be made of quality cable and molded ends are great.

Reviews.Title: Power supply included
Reviews.Author: Marcus C Farrant III
Reviews.Content: The product comes with the 12 volt power supply as well as 2 splitters.  Unfortunately the picture only shows a 8 way splitter and no power supply.

Reviews.Title: CCtv
Reviews.Author: Gary Swanson
Reviews.Content: I wanted to power cameras for my home security system and not have  sixteen seperate power supplys. this work great

Reviews.Title: They don't last long.
Reviews.Author: J. Jensen "IT Guy"
Reviews.Content: I'm on my second Q-See adapter.Both of them direct from Q-See.Once they start to fail, you'll get horizontal lines on the output video.This is my second power adapter, in 18 months on this Q-See 8 camera DVR.One power adapter, for 8 cameras.My other (higher end) Q-See system came with a power distribution box (not a small power supply) with a 10amp rating, for 8 cameras. No problems in the 18 months being installed. It's also sold on Amazon, for around $55-60.00 and is labeled by Q-See. Pre connectorized with 8 PL-21 power connectors, and plugs into 110V via a provided cable.I recommend a 7amp or great power supply.You never want to run your power supply at it's limit or close to the limits. Better to get a bit bigger unit, for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: All Parts Included
Reviews.Author: D. Lord
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Q-See QM6006B-4 camera system and installed it using two 100 foot long cables and two of the standard 60 foot cables, which came with the system. About three weeks later, all four of my cameras were not working and all I saw was "Video Loss". Q-See's product support / customer service was no help (ridiculously slow to respond with little to no information). After troubleshooting and some research via the Web, I was able to determine that the power adapter was not working. The 3000mA power adapter that came with the system was insufficient because I added a couple of longer cables, which required more power or caused a power loss. This product is more than sufficient to power my four cameras because it is 5000mA (5amps). It comes with one four wire splitter and one eight wire splitter, so you can use whichever you require. I now have peace of mind that my system will not stop working. Additionally, I have included a photo since the one already posted does not show what exactly you get.

Reviews.Title: It looks ok
Reviews.Author: terry monroe
Reviews.Content: I have not use this item yet. Therefore, I can't say much about itI will write about it after I use it

Reviews.Title: works as it should
Reviews.Content: works fine.priced ok.shipped fast.kinda wished this style connector had a way of locking connections so they can't be pulled apart by weight of wires. tape is only solution i found and lifting wires with wire management is the only cure.it's not manufactures fault there are no locking mechanisms, just saying it would be nice and worth the extra costs passed down to us.
